ack.p: Access to unpublished oak data was provided by the following organizations and individuals. For Q. petraea data: Brigitte Musch and the staff of the French Office National des Forêts (ONF); François Ehrenmann, Sylvain Delzon, Jean Marc Louvet and Patrick Reynet (deceased), at INRA Cestas, France; Jean-Baptiste Lamy at IFREMER, France; Hans-Martin Rau, Jochen Kleinschmit, Josef Svolba, Niedersächsische Forstliche Versuchsanstalt, Abteilung Forstpflanzenzüchtung, Staufenberg, Escherode, Germany; Mirko Liesebach, Volker Schneck, Klaus Liepe and Armin O. König, Thünen-Institut für Forstgenetik, Grosshansdorf, Germany; Wilfried Steiner, Alwin Janssen, Nordwestdeutsche Forstliche Versuchsanstalt, Abteilung Waldgenressourcen, Hann-Münden, Germany; Władysław Chałupka, Henryk Fober, Instytut Dendrologii PAN, Kórnik, Poland; Steve J. Lee, Alan M. Fletcher and Edward P. Cundall, Northern Research Station, Scotland; Stephen Cavers, John Douglas Deans, Centre for Ecology & Hydrology, Bush Estate, Penicuik, Midlothian, United Kingdom; Said Dağdaş and M Kizmaz, Forest Research Institute, Ankara, Turkey; Bart de Cuyper and Alphonse Nanson, Station de Recherches Forestières et Hydrobiologiques, Groenendaal-Hoeilaart, Belgium; László Széll, Forest Research Institute Botanikus kert, Sárvár, Hungary; Tore Skrøppa, Norwegian Forest Research Institute, Ås, Norway and Finnvid Prescher, Södra Fröstation, Lagan, Sweden. For F. sylvatica, P. abies and, P. sylvestris published data were used, and the sources are listed in Appendix S1. We thank Gerald E. Rehfeldt for important advice concerning the analysis of mixed models and Ana Laura Cruzado-Vargas for assistance in the construction of climate graphs. Suggestions from the Academic Editor, Andrew Robinson, and from three reviewers (Laura Leites and two anonymous reviewers) helped us to improve this manuscript significantly. A professional native English-speaking editor (Alex Edelman & Associates) also significantly improved the manuscript.
